text: The Nickel Plate Road S,S1,S2 and S3 Class 2-8-4â€™s were a class of 80 American 2-8-4 type steam locomotives built by ALCO and Lima for the New York Chicago and St.Louis Railroad aka the Nickel Plate Road between 1934 and 1949 . They were scrapped from 1957-1964 except for 4 S2 Class and 1 S3 Class were preserved. The NKP S Class 2-8-4 looked the same like the Pere Marquette N Class 2-8-4
title: Nickel Plate Road S Class 2-8-4
